author: Raivo Laanemets
message:
Packaging and distribution of library code is quite hard problem. I recently got my troubles with SWI-Prolog packs (http://www.swi-prolog.org/p.... You can't even specify a version when installing something! Had to switch to git submodules instead (lucky if all your deps have git repos!).

"explicitly specify files to include in the source archives". This is a good thing. Node's NPM does it other way around and the result is all kinds of sensitive stuff (keys, dotfiles, command history, etc.) in packages. While it is the best package manager I have seen so far, its code is very very complex and rewritten from scratch at least once (this might actually be a good thing).

Congrats for releasing stuff despite all of these issues with package managers!

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I agree shipping dot files is not a good idea. That's why I would like to be able to use `git archive` which can create a tarball from checked in files.

author: Cyrille Rossant
message: Saying that Python packaging is a mess is an euphemism.

author: Marius Gedminas
message:
You may want to check out https://pypi.python.org/pyp... to avoid MANIFEST.in discrepancies.

The worst thing about Python packaging is all the tribal knowledge that's being passed around by word of mouth, instead of being clearly documented in one obvious place :(
